results.title: First blood (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Buzz Feitshans, Orion Pictures Corporation and Ted Kotcheff
results.brief_description: His body and mind were brutally scarred from Vietnam. Then the small-town cop threatened him, abused and caged him like a wild animal - not like the hero he really was. They finally pushed him too far and all hell broke loose as he declared his own war against them. Rated: M Caption Version only Available.

results.title: First blood
results.creator_credit: Buzz Feitshans, Orion Pictures Corporation and Ted Kotcheff
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by David Morrell, “First Blood” began a trilogy of action films starring Sylvester Stallone as the tough but troubled Vietnam war veteran, John Rambo. Scarred from his horrific experiences in Vietnam, Rambo is abused by a power hungry “red-necked” sherriff in a small town who imprisons him. However, a caged Rambo is a dangerous beast and when he escapes the explosive action begins. Putting credibility aside, this is a prime example of the action movie genre which launched the careers of actors like Stallone, Schwarzenegger and Van Damme.

results.brief_description: Shows the correct procedure for caring for an injured person from the time of the injury until the doctor arrives.

results.title: First aid: fundamentals
results.brief_description: Defines first aid as the first emergency help given to an injured or sick person to help ease pain and prevent further injury. Explains how to treat skin wounds, minor burns, rashes, sprained ankles, and bruises; how to administer artificial respiration; and how to stop bleeding and prevent infection and shock.

results.title: First aid: fire, accident and home safety
results.creator_credit: Dept of Health, Richmond Implementation Unit, Tony Shaddock, Sally Collier and Tim Abbott
results.brief_description: Designed to introduce the intellectual disability residential care worker to basic household precautions to avoid accident and fire, basic accident first aid techniques for use before the arrival of professional help, the different types of fire and how to deal with them and basic emergency procedures for evacuation and movement of residents in case of fire. Accompanied by 52p. in-service training manual.

results.title: First aid: everyday emergencies
results.brief_description: Describes treatment for snakebite; poison taken internally; poison ivy, oak and sumac; chemical in the eye; soft and hard foreign matter in the eye; foreign object in the nose; bug or insect in the ear; something stuck in the throat; splinters; blisters; faintness; artificial respiration, back-pressure armlift method; carbon monoxide poisoning and electric shock.

results.title: First aid training in personnel damage control. No. 4. Fractures
results.creator_credit: Wilding Picture Productions and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description: In this film, instructions are given to sailors on how to give first aid for fractured bones. Animation is used to describe the human skeletal system, the effects of fractures on muscle, blood vessels, skin, and nerves, to illustrate the difference between simple and compound fractures, and to illustrate the effects of a Thomas splint.

results.title: First aid on the spot
results.brief_description: Six common types of injuries and disabilities and the American Red Cross technique for treating each, with demonstrations of caring for wounds, burns and schock; of controlling bleeding; splinting a fracture; and administering artificial respiraiton by both approved methods.

results.title: First aid on the dairy farm
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Tasmanian Government Film Unit and Cineservice
results.brief_description: Cases in which the farmer can be of immediate aid to his animals, before calling the veterinarian. The film deals with milk fever, pink eye, mastitis, teat injuries, administration of medicine, bloat, choke, prussic acid poisoning, wounds, first aid kit.
